relANNIS_2_0.relANNISDAO
Class ExtFileTupleWriter

java.lang.Object
  relANNIS_2_0.relANNISDAO.TupleWriter
      relANNIS_2_0.relANNISDAO.ExtFileTupleWriter

public class ExtFileTupleWriter
extends TupleWriter

Dieser TupleWriter kann BLOBs in ein Insert-Script für Postgress schreiben. Außerdem werden alle Blob-Dateien in ein übergebenes Verzeichniss kopiert und von dort aus importiert.

Author:
Administrator

Constructor Detail

ExtFileTupleWriter

public ExtFileTupleWriter(java.lang.String relName,
                          java.io.File outFile,
                          java.io.File extDir,
                          boolean override,
                          boolean isTemp)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a new ExtFileTupleWriter-Object which works like a TupleWriter with extension for copying external files in a special directory. Also the pathname will be inserted as attribute in tuple.

Parameters:
relName - String - the name of the relation, to where the tuples will be flushed
outFile - File - reference to the output file (bulk loader file for postgres)
extDir - File - reference to the external directory
override - boolean - if set to true, a already existing outfile will be overridden
isTemp - boolean - says if the outfile is just temprorary
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Method Detail

copyFiles

protected static void copyFiles(java.io.File from,
                                java.io.File to)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
This method copies a binary file. The file reference will be overridden if exists.

Parameters:
from - File - file which should be copied
to - File - file reference to where the file should copied
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addTuple

public java.io.File addTuple(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> tuple,
                             java.io.File extFile,
                             long pos)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Adds a new tuple to the sequence of tuples and inserts it to the tuple stream. In opposite to TupleWriter this object stores an external file in seperate folder and adds a reference to the tuple.

Parameters:
Vector - tuple - the tuple for insert
extFile - File - the external file which has to be added to the tuple and the external directory
pos - long - the position where the reference in the tuple should be inserted
subDir - String - an extension of the external directory where the file should be placed
Returns:
a file object which points to the final destination where the given file is placed
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addTuple

public java.io.File addTuple(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> tuple,
                             java.io.File extFile,
                             long pos,
                             boolean override)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Adds a new tuple to the sequence of tuples and inserts it to the tuple stream. In opposite to TupleWriter this object stores an external file in seperate folder and adds a reference to the tuple.

Parameters:
Vector - tuple - the tuple for insert
extFile - File - the external file which has to be added to the tuple and the external directory
pos - long - the position where the reference in the tuple should be inserted
subDir - String - an extension of the external directory where the file should be placed
override - boolean - should be true if the a file with the name of where the extFile should be copied already exists
Returns:
a file object which points to the final destination where the given file is placed
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addTuple

public java.io.File addTuple(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> tuple,
                             java.io.File extFile,
                             long pos,
                             java.lang.String subDir,
                             boolean override)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Adds a new tuple to the sequence of tuples and inserts it to the tuple stream. In opposite to TupleWriter this object stores an external file in seperate folder and adds a reference to the tuple.

Parameters:
Vector - tuple - the tuple for insert
extFile - File - the external file which has to be added to the tuple and the external directory
pos - long - the position where the reference in the tuple should be inserted (starts at 0)
subDir - String - an extension of the external directory where the file should be placed
override - boolean - should be true if the a file with the name of where the extFile should be copied already exists
Returns:
a file object which points to the final destination where the given file is placed
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
